definition: to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself

sentences.english: You need to be tough to survive the jungle.
sentences.chinese: 要在翟林中活下赖就要有坚忍不跋的鱼志。

sentences.english: Shall we not be as persevering and hopeful as to heavenly things?
sentences.chinese: 对于属天的事情，我们为甚么不能这样坚忍呢？

sentences.english: This was no grim duty to which I stoically resigned, however.
sentences.chinese: 然而，这并非我须坚忍顺从的痛苦职责。

sentences.english: Our security is assured by our perseverance and by our sure belief in the success of liberty.
sentences.chinese: 对自由的坚信不移和坚忍不拔是我们安全的保证。

sentences.english: The old man watched Enzo with patient eyes.
sentences.chinese: 那位老人用坚忍的目光看着恩佐。

sentences.english: Only by hard study and much patience can one master a foreign language.
sentences.chinese: 只有靠努力学习和坚忍不拔的意志才能掌握外语。

sentences.english: Thus you trudge along, stoical, uncomplaining.
sentences.chinese: 你们就这样坚忍无怨地蹒跚而行。

sentences.english: Stick with it Douglas. Your fortitude is an example to us all.
sentences.chinese: 道格拉斯坚持下去，你的坚忍不拔是我们大家的榜样。

sentences.english: Could China weather the subsequent financial turmoil as stoically as Japan?
sentences.chinese: 中国在经历如此的金融风暴后会像日本一样的坚忍么？

sentences.english: Do you want to be courageous, disciplined, creative, and persistent or not?
sentences.chinese: 你是否希望自己勇敢，自制，敢于创新并且坚忍不拔？

sentences.english: His strength lies in his perseverance.
sentences.chinese: 他的强项在于他的坚忍。

sentences.english: Marcus Aurelius is a famous stoic philosopher.
sentences.chinese: 马库斯Aurelius是一位著名坚忍的哲学家。

sentences.english: Added to innate stoicism he also made writing his other self.
sentences.chinese: 天生就坚忍淡泊的他更是将写作变成了另外一个自我。

sentences.english: He persevered amidst all these difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 他在这些困难中始终坚忍。

sentences.english: Perseverance is a quality that behoves in a scientist.
sentences.chinese: 坚忍不拔是科学家应当具备的品质。

definition: firm and indomitable (idiom); tenacious and unyielding
to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
see 百折不撓|百折不挠[bai3 zhe2 bu4 nao2]
to bear patiently/to endure silently/to forbear
